story.title: Luna Makes New Friends
story.subtitle: A story about courage, connection, and being yourself
story.description: Join Luna the little bunny as she visits the park and learns about making friends, finding courage to reach out, and discovering that being yourself is the best way to connect with others.
story.author: StoryQuest Team
contentWarnings: This story gently addresses feeling lonely and nervous about making friends
Contains themes about trying new things and taking social risks
Includes positive resolution and friendship-building strategies
healingGoals: Learning that it's okay to feel nervous
Understanding that being yourself attracts real friends
Developing courage to reach out to others
Recognizing that rejection doesn't define your worth
story.professionalGuidance: This story helps children develop social courage and understand that making friends involves taking small, brave steps. It normalizes social anxiety while providing practical strategies for connection. Use the conversation guide to explore the child's own experiences with friendship and belonging.

nodes.text: Luna was feeling good in her safe new home. Today, her caregiver smiled and said, 'Luna, would you like to go to the park? There are other young animals playing there.' Luna's ears perked up... but then drooped a little. She wanted to meet friends, but what if they didn't like her?

choices.therapeuticNote: Child choosing to face their fear

nodes.text: 'What kind of animals will be there?' Luna asked quietly. Her caregiver smiled warmly. 'All kinds! Some shy ones, some playful ones. Just like you, they all want to have fun and feel included. And I'll be right there with you the whole time.'

Luna took a big, deep breath. In... and out. Her caregiver showed her how to breathe slowly when she felt nervous. 'That's it, Luna. You're so brave for trying something new.' Luna's heart felt a little calmer now.

The park was beautiful! Green grass, tall trees, and in the distance, Luna could hear laughter and play. She saw a group of young animals playing together - a fox, a hedgehog, and a little bird. Her tummy felt fluttery.

Luna sat on a bench and watched the others play. It was okay to watch first - she was learning about them. The fox was energetic and ran fast. The hedgehog was gentle and kind. The bird sang beautiful songs. After a while, the hedgehog noticed Luna and gave a small, friendly smile.

Luna took a brave breath and waved her paw. The little hedgehog saw her and waved back! 'Hi!' the hedgehog called out. 'Do you want to play with us?' Luna's heart beat fast, but in a good way. Someone wanted to play with her!

Luna looked away, feeling shy. That was okay - sometimes we need a moment. But then she heard a gentle voice. 'It's okay to feel shy,' said the hedgehog, who had walked over quietly. 'I felt shy my first time here too. My name is Holly.'

The hedgehog's smile grew bigger when Luna smiled back. The hedgehog hopped over slowly. 'Hi! I'm Holly. I like your ears - they're really soft-looking!' Luna felt warm inside. Someone noticed something nice about her.

'I'm Luna,' she said, her voice quiet but clear. Holly's eyes lit up. 'Luna! What a beautiful name. Would you like to meet the others? We're playing a game where we find the smoothest pebbles. It's fun!'

'Thank you! And you have really kind eyes,' Luna said. Holly blushed under her quills. 'That's so sweet! I think we're going to be good friends, Luna.' And just like that, Luna's heart felt lighter. Being kind to others felt good!

Luna nodded. Holly understood and just sat beside her quietly. They watched the others play together. After a few minutes, Luna felt ready. 'Holly?' she whispered. 'Can we... can we play too?' Holly beamed. 'Of course! Come on!'

'Maybe in a minute,' Luna said. The hedgehog nodded understandingly. 'That's okay! We'll be right here when you're ready.' Luna felt grateful. These animals understood that sometimes you need time, and that was okay.

Luna watched as they played. She noticed how they took turns, how they helped each other, how they laughed together. It looked... safe. It looked fun. Luna realized she wanted to be part of that. She stood up.

'How do you play?' Luna asked. Holly explained patiently, showing her where to look for pebbles and what made them special. Luna liked that Holly took time to help her understand. Good friends help each other learn new things.

Luna joined the group. At first she felt nervous, but then something wonderful happened. She found a really smooth, pretty pebble! 'Look at this one!' she said. The fox, hedgehog, and bird all gathered around. 'Wow, Luna! That's the best one yet!' they cheered.

endings.text: Luna looked at her beautiful pebble, then at Holly who had been so kind. 'Here, Holly. I want you to have it.' Holly's eyes sparkled. 'Really? Thank you, Luna! You're a really good friend.' And Luna realized - she WAS a good friend. Being generous felt wonderful. The others gathered around, and they all played together until sunset. Luna had found her people.

Luna felt brave. 'I know a fun game!' she said. 'We could make pictures with our pebbles!' The others loved the idea. Soon they were all creating beautiful patterns together, and Luna was leading the way. She discovered that when you're being yourself, you can add something special to the group. She had found her confidence and her friends.

'Can we play again tomorrow?' Luna asked hopefully. 'YES!' they all shouted together. Holly hugged her gently. 'You're one of us now, Luna.' As Luna walked home with her caregiver, her heart felt full. She belonged somewhere. She had friends who liked her just the way she was. Tomorrow couldn't come soon enough.

The sun began to set, painting the sky in beautiful colors. Luna sat with her new friends, all of them quiet and happy. She didn't need to talk all the time. Sometimes friendship was just being together, feeling safe and peaceful. Luna looked up at her caregiver, who smiled back proudly. Luna had done something brave today. She had opened her heart to friendship.

conversationGuides.title: Before Reading: Preparing for the Story
questions: Have you ever felt nervous about meeting new people?
What makes you feel brave when you try something new?
Do you have friends? What do you like about them?
activities: Take some deep breaths together like Luna does
Talk about what makes a good friend
observations: Note child's comfort level discussing friendship
Watch for signs of social anxiety or past rejection

conversationGuides.title: During Reading: Engaging with Luna's Journey
questions: How do you think Luna is feeling right now?
What would you do if you were Luna?
Do you think Holly is being a good friend?
activities: Let the child choose what Luna does
Pause to discuss the different choices
observations: Notice which choices the child gravitates toward
Watch for emotional responses to friendship themes

conversationGuides.title: After Reading: Processing and Connecting
questions: What did Luna learn about making friends?
What was the bravest thing Luna did?
If you could give Luna advice, what would you tell her?
Have you ever made a friend? How did it happen?
activities: Draw a picture of Luna with her new friends
Practice introducing yourself to someone new
Talk about times when you've been brave like Luna
observations: Note child's understanding of friendship concepts
Watch for personal connections to the story
Assess readiness to practice social skills
